description:
Change of use of first to fourth floors from office use
(Class B1) to residential use together with an additional
fifth floor also for residential use to provide 7 social
housing units in all,
as shown on drawing numbers 1111/101-111, photographs 1111/
112 and supporting statement.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development shall be constructed in strict accordance with the drawings hereby approved or drawings which are subsequently approved pursuant to conditions which are attached to this planning permission.

Condition : 2 - No meter boxes, flues, vents or pipes shall be fixed or installed on the [external face][street elevations] of the building.

Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the character of the immediate area in accordance with the requirements of policies EN1 and EN13 [and EN31 if in a CA] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 3 - The residential accomodation hereby approved shall not be used as temporary sleeping accomodation (including holiday lettings) as defined in Section 25 of the G.L.C. (General Powers) Act 1983.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the first occupation of the units, the rising duct
    shown on the application drawings shall be so provided and
    the current extraction system from the restaurant below
    shall be relocated into it.

Condition : 5 - At 1 metre outside the windows of any neighbouring habitable room the level of noise from all plant and machinery shall be at all times at least 5 decibels below the existing background noise levels, expressed in dB(A) at such locations. Where the noise from the plant and machinery is tonal in character the differences in these levels shall be at least 10 dB(A).

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the [adjoining] premises [and the area generally] in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the commencement of work on site, a scheme providing for the insulation of the proposed dwellings against the transmission of externally generated traffic noise [and vibration] from .....��� shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. Any works which form part of the scheme shall be completed in accordance with the approved details before the dwellings are occupied.

Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the premises in accordance with the requirements of policy[ies] RE2[, EN5, EN6 and DS6] of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 7 - Before the development commences, samples of the proposed
    fenestration facing Farringdon Road shall be submitted to
    and approved by the Council. The development shall not be
    carried out otherwise than in strict accordance with the
    details thus approved.

Condition : 8 - Before the units hereby approved are first occupied, the
    cycle parking shown on 1111.105 shall be so provided for the
    benefit of the residents and thereafter maintained
    permanently for the duration of the uses.

Condition : 9 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 10 - Because it is considered that these would seriously detract
    from the appearance of the building in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN33 and EN16 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 11 - To ensure that the use of the accommodation accords with the
    Council's housing policies in order to ensure compliance
    with the requirements of policy HG23 of the London Borough
    of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 12 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 13 - In order to ensure that the new development is adequately
    protected against the penetration of noise in accordance
    with the requirements of policy RE* of the London Borough of
    Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 14 - To safeguard the amenities of the adjoining premises and the
    area generally in accordance with the requirements of policy
    RE* of the London Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan
    2000.

Condition : 15 - To safeguard the appearance of the premises and the
    character of the immediate area in accordance with the
    requirements of policies EN1, EN16 and EN33 of the London
    Borough of Camden Unitary Development Plan 2000.

Condition : 16 - In order to accord with the Council's parking policies and
    development standards as expressed in policy TR17 and
    Supplementary Planning Guidance.

Condition : 17 - The correct street number or number and name must be
    displayed permanently on the premises in accordance with
    regulations made under Section 12 of the London Building
    (Amendments) Act 1939 (IH07)

Condition : 18 - Your attention is drawn to the fact that there is a separate
    legal agreement with the Council which relates to the
    development for which this permission is granted.

Condition : 19 - With regard to plant: you are advised that although a roof
    plant area is shown on the application drawings, no plant is
    permitted in this application. In good time, prior to works
    commencing, a separate application for plant will be
    necessary.

Condition : 20 - The development hereby approved must be carried out in
    strict compliance with the plans referred to in this
    permission. Any alteration to the approved scheme resulting
    either from the requirements of the Building Control
    Manager, or for any other cause, must not take place except
    with the written agreement of the Council as local planning
    authority.

Condition : 21 - The Building Regulations may impose requirements for sound
    insulation between dwellings, and you are advised to consult
    Building Control Service, located at Camden Town Hall
    Argyle Street, WC1H 8EQ. (Tel: 020 7974 6941)

Condition : 22 - The Council's Streets Management Engineering Services should
    be consulted regarding the construction of the crossover on
    the public highway and any other work to, under, or over,
    the public highway, including vaults and thresholds. The
    Section dealing with these matters is located at Camden Town
    Hall, Argyle Street London WC1H 8EQ, (tel: 020-7278 4444).
